extracted_information: The provided web content details Microsoft Word's content control features, primarily focusing on Word 2013's capabilities and programmatic manipulation. It covers various content control types, visualization improvements, XML mapping for data integration, and the introduction of repeating section content controls. Information relevant to 2025 is limited to a general Microsoft Ignite event date, with the technical details pertaining to Word 2013 features as of a 2022 article update.

features.name: Content Controls
features.description: Microsoft Word entities that act as containers for specific content, enabling creation of rich, structured blocks. Used in templates to define content position, type (date, picture, text), editing restrictions, and semantic meaning.
improvements_word_2013: Improved visualization (Bounding Box, Start/End tags, None display states)
Support for XML Mapping for Rich Text content controls

features.name: Repeating Section Content Control
features.description: New in Word 2013, this control repeats content within it, including other content controls. Can be inserted around entire paragraphs or table rows. Allows users to add copies of the section or delete sections by name if configured.
features.behavior_with_child_controls: Enclosed content controls are repeated but reset to placeholder text, except for child repeating section controls or XML-mapped controls outside the repeating section.
features.xml_mapping_behavior: Absolute binding (shows same content) if mapping does not intersect with node set; Relative binding (remapped) if mapping intersects with node set.

features.name: XML Mapping for Content Controls (Integration with External Data Sources)
features.description: Ability to map content of rich text content controls and document building block content controls to the XML data store within the document. The custom XML is stored as flat Open XML markup converted into a string.
features.limitation: Can only successfully map to leaf nodes or attributes.
features.recommendation_for_repeating_sections: Lock the repeating section content control and allow editing only in unlocked child content controls that are also XML-mapped to prevent data loss upon document reopening.

features.name: Advanced Template Creation Capabilities (Object Model)
features.description: Programmatic manipulation of content controls using the Word 2013 object model (VBA).
object_model_members_repeating_section: RepeatingSectionItem object (members: Range, Delete, InsertItemAfter, InsertItemBefore)
open_xml_file_format_schema_additions: w:appearance (child of w:sdtPr, values: boundingBox, tags, hidden)
